HTMLMediaElementSrcObject.summary:
The srcObject property of the
interface sets or returns the object which serves as
the source of the media associated with the .

remarks.para:
The object can be a , a , a
, or a (which inherits from Blob).

blockquote.para: Note: As of March 2020, only Safari has full support for srcObject, i.e. using MediaSource, MediaStream, Blob, and File objects as values. Other browsers support MediaStream objects; until they catch up, consider falling back to creating a URL with and assigning it to (see below for an example). In addition, as of version 108 Chromium supports attaching a dedicated worker MediaSource object by assigning that object's instance (transferred from the worker) to srcObject.

HTMLMediaElementSrcObject.value:
A , , , or
object (though see the compatibility table for what is actually
supported).
